title: No Inbox Display

title: Can't install Hotmail account on Thunderbird
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for my hotmail.com and cox.net accounts for many years. Recently cox transitioned to yahoo.com with their email and users had to transition over. I was able to do this for 5 accounts - no problem. My hotmail.com was a bit more of a challenge but I was able to get it to work. Last week I started getting sign-in errors. Nothing worked and I deleted my hotmail.com address in Thunderbird figuring it would be better to just start over - wrong choice. Now I cannot even install my hotmail.com account on my Thunderbird.

I first tried the straightforward approach. Get an app password from my Microsoft account. Nest I it account actions, add email account. I added my name, email address and app password. When I hit ok a message quickly flashed saying configuration doesn't work. When I done I get a message that server already exists. I tried going to manual configuration and changed to normal password but got the message again that server exists. I went to the Outgoing server (SMTP) list but the outlook server doesn't show up.I tried using the hotmail password instead og the app password with same results. Finally I logged out of Thunderbird, turned off the two party requirement in Outlook and again tried to add the account to Thunderbird. Now I get the message 'could not get issuer fot oauth2 authentication'. I next went into manual configuration, turned authentication to 'normal password' the the hotmail account installed.

I closed Thunderbird and started again. sent a message to the hotmail account and had to reenter the password - works. Tried to send a message and was asked againgn for the app password - then it works. So all is good except when I check the server settings for smtp and IMAP, ot shows 'normal password' After strugglig for two hours I do not want to risk changing them to oauth2. Checked under 'saved logins' and the app password is shown. Is it likely that I have arrived at a stable solution? What am I risking by having the 'normal password' authentication?
creator: duhnel

title: cannot find server

title: unable to write email to mailbox
content: I have a new windows 10 machine and have a new install of Thunderbird. Hosting email server has 2966 emails that I would like to recover. Started process of downloading them and got to 1895 when it failed with the error message "Unable to write email to mailbox" Check the settings. Tried removing the account and recreating it. Removed the 1895 emails that I have downloaded and got the same result. It seems to be broken some where between Thunderbird and the hosting mailserver as I can login via webmail and see and read the balance of 1071 emails. Techs at the hosting server company have no idea what could be causing the problem. Any help would be appreciated. Regards, Richard
creator: freedom13

title: Unified Inbox marked as favorite folder does not stay in favorite folder section after Thunderbird restart
content:
Hi. A previous thread was archived on this (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1418749) but it is still an issue in 115.12.2 (64-bit), macOS.

  1. Turn on Unified Folders.
  2. Mark the unified Inbox as a favorite. It appears in favorite folders.
  3. Restart Thunderbird.
  4. Other favorite folders still appear, but Inbox is gone. It is still marked as a favorite folder however.
  5. If you toggle the unified Inbox favorite on and off, it reappears.
creator: arturo502

title: Thunderbird emailing service required
content:
I wish to access my emails through Thunderbird (in addition to Zimbra) . On a previous computer I had both providers working side by side without difficulty. However my attempted download of Thunderbird is thwarted by the message "you are about to override how Thunderbird identifies with this site. Legitimate banks, stores and other sites will not ask you to do this".

My further investigations online suggest I should "check where my email is posted (My broadband connection is with Shell Energy) and if in the same domain as the mail server, create the security exception".

I am not sufficiently computer literate to understand all this and Shell Energy say they cannot advise me. I do not wish to lose my existing email access via Zimbra and wish to continue using my email address. Would creating the security exception solve the problem and enable me to get both email services together? 

With thanks, Patrick Palmer
creator: patrick.palmer

title: Signature / podpisy
content:
Ahoj mam prosbu. Presel jsem z outlooku na thunderbird ale nejak se mi nedari nastavit prepinani podpisu. Pro predstavu mam podpis "A" a "B" a ja si dokazu nastavit aby se mi podpis A nebo B vkladal do mailu ale mohu tam mit jen jeden. Ale ja bych potreboval mezi nimi umet prepinat. Napriklad standartne pisu mail s podpisem A ale vyjimecne napisu mail treba v jinem jazyce a potrebuji tam vlozit podpis B. Mam vlastni velikost, styl a barvu pisma a pod tim vlozeny obrazek. Pro predstavu prikladam oba podpisy. Zkusil jsem doplnek Quicktext ale nepodarilo se mi do nej dat presne tyto podpisy. Jde to nejak? A jeste jeden dotaz. Jde nastavit aby pozadi odeslaneho mailu nebylo bile ale cerne? Aby kazdy komu mail poslu mel cerne pozadi a bily text a ne obracene? Diky.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Hi, I have a request. I have switched from outlook to thunderbird but somehow I can't set up signature switching. To give you an idea, I have a signature "A" and "B" and I can set the signature A or B to be inserted in my mail but I can only have one. But I would need to be able to switch between them. For example, I normally write mail with signature A but exceptionally I write mail in another language and I need to insert signature B. I have my own font size, style and color and a picture underneath. For an idea I attach both signatures. I have tried Quicktext addon but I couldn't get these signatures into it. Is there any way? And one more question. Is it possible to set the background of the sent mail to black instead of white? So that everyone to whom I send mail has a black background and white text and not reversed? Thank you.
creator: Farkpoint

title: OAuth2 is REQUIRED now for MS Outlook email, now I get prompts for passwords
content:
I got an email from Microsoft saying my Live.com or Outlook.com email accounts won't be supported in Thunderbird UNLESS I change the settings to OAuth2 in incoming and outgoing server settings.

I even REMOVED the email account and re-added it making sure it was OAuth2.

But for my live.com & outlook.com email accounts I continually get prompts for passwords from Thunderbird. Sometimes I can't even click the RED X at the upper right to shut the prompt down. I just happens over and over until I give it what it wants.

I am tempted to shut down all Microsoft email accounts and switch to Gmail.

I have Thunderbird version 115.12.2 (64-bit) I used Windows 11 23H2 build 22631.3810 Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.22700.1020.0

Any idea how to stop these prompts?

I like Thunderbird much more than any other email program I have ever used, and would like to keep it
creator: nicholasb55

title: Thunderbird - missing emails
content:
I have my email account set up on my phone (Android) and on Thunderbird. Both are set up the same way receiving emails via POP Mail server. Messages are left on the server until I delete them. Certain messages appear on my phone but never appear in Thunderbird. I do not have any spam filters set up on Thunderbird. Junk settings are set such that messages from people in my personal address book are not treated as junk, and yet they are also amongst those that do not appear. Junk messages, in any case, are not moved from my mail folder.

Furthermore if I try to forward the missing messages from my phone (where they appear) to myself again, they will still not appear in Thunderbird.

Why cannot I not see those (missing) messages?

title: Archived emails disappeared
content: I move old emails to archive folders, by year, when I get around to it. Today decided to shift emails from Sent file back to 2020, and from Inbox for all of 2022 and for the first half of 2023. Archived each year's batch separately. In every case I got a "Thunderbird not responding", so eventually stopped it via Task Manager. When I restarted, all the highlighted emails had been moved properly. When I did it for the first half of 2023, all the emails appeared as expected in the 2023 Archive folder ... for a few seconds. Then they all disappeared, as did much of the content of the other annual archive folders. What do I do to recover all those emails?
creator: rightcoaster

title: Migrating from a Windows 10 computer to a Windows 11 computer and many aspects are not working correctly
content:
I'm migrating Thunderbird from my old Windows 10 computer to a new Windows 11 computer.

I've installed Thunderbird v115.12.2 and successfully moved all my accounts, emails, calendars, etc., to the new computer.

Several things are NOT working correctly, though:

1 - Settings will not open. Here is the message from the error console:

Error: No such tab mode: preferencesTab 

   openTab chrome://messenger/content/tabmail.js:758    openTab chrome://communicator/content/utilityOverlay.js:257    openPreferencesTab chrome://communicator/content/utilityOverlay.js:295    openOptionsDialog chrome://messenger/content/mailCore.js:628    oncommand chrome://messenger/content/messenger.xhtml:1

tabmail.js:956:17 

   openTab chrome://messenger/content/tabmail.js:956    openTab chrome://communicator/content/utilityOverlay.js:257    openPreferencesTab chrome://communicator/content/utilityOverlay.js:295    openOptionsDialog chrome://messenger/content/mailCore.js:628    oncommand chrome://messenger/content/messenger.xhtml:1

2 - Customize menu does not open

3 - The hamburger menu in the upper right corner does not open

4 - The spaces toolbar on the far left is missing

5 - Events and Tasks are missing from the menu

6 - My calendar is nowhere to be found - I can't find a way to access it (on my old computer, I clicked on the calendar icon in the spaces toolbar on the left side of the window)

Thunderbird on my old computer was also running v115.12.2 when I backed up the profile folder to move it.

I tried downgrading to Thunderbird v102. I had all of the same issues listed above PLUS all my accounts and emails disappeared. -- I've brought it back up to v115.12.2.

Could someone please help me get Thunderbird working correctly?
creator: RowdyRhonda
